notice.ch: 本課程上下學期授課內容不同

remark.ch: 本課程上下學期授課內容不同

goal.ch:
Course Objective 
(課程目標)

This is a course devoted to developing students’ Business English skills of listening and speaking. The topics selected from Market Leader: Upper Intermediate Business English Course Book (3rd Edition Extra) can be of interest to students. Other timely, authentic and insightful materials chosen from different sources will also be selected to provide opportunities for discussions and personalized practices in class. 

Students will practice English through a series of collaborative activities, such as participating in group discussion and pair discussion, role-playing, presenting individual reports as well as team projects. The purpose of all the activities is to promote the development of the linguistic skills which students need to succeed in business communication.
goal.en:
Course Objective 

This is a course devoted to developing students’ Business English skills of listening and speaking. The topics selected from Market Leader: Upper Intermediate Business English Course Book (3rd Edition Extra) can be of interest to students. Other timely, authentic and insightful materials chosen from different sources will also be selected to provide opportunities for discussions and personalized practices in class. 

Students will practice English through a series of collaborative activities, such as participating in group discussion and pair discussion, role-playing, presenting individual reports as well as team projects. The purpose of all the activities is to promote the development of the linguistic skills which students need to succeed in business communication.

outline.ch:
Course Outline
(課程進度)
1 (9 /11 )
1.  Breaking the Ice
2.  Introduction and Course Description
3.  Information sharing (Self-introduction)
4.  How to Control Stage Fright
5.  Q＆A
2 ( 9/18 )
1.Discussion: Classroom Policies
2.Starting up: What Makes a Good Communicator?
3.Group Discussion: What Forms of Written and Spoken Communication Do You Like Using? Why?
4.Vocabulary Development: Good Communicators
HW: 1.How Could Bad Communicators Improve Their Communication Skills?
2. Is Communication Better These Days with All the New Technology?
3 ( 9/25 )
1.Starting Up: How Could Bad Communicators Improve Their Communication Skills?
2.Discussion: What Are the Advantage and Disadvantage of Doing Web Presentation?
3.Listening Practice: Improving Communications
4.Discussion: Is Communication Better These Days with All the New Technology?
5.Skills: Dealing with Communication Breakdown
HW: 1.Language Review: Idioms (A+B)
2. The Invented Slogans for the Brand Slogan Guessing Game
4 ( 10/02 )
1.Language Review: Idioms (C)
2.Starting up: Do You Buy Brands?
3.Discussion: Why Do People Like or Dislike Brands?
4.Vocabulary: Marketing Word Partnership (A+B)
5.Listening Practice: How to Maket Internationally?
6.Discussion: Clever Slogans for Brand Products (the Slogan Guessing Game)
7.Group discussion: Advertising Campaign for(a Taiwanese product) to Be Marketed Internationally
HW: What Is Free Trade?
Note: Advertising Campaign for (a Taiwanese product) to Be Marketed Internationally
5 ( 10/09)
1.Discussion: What Is Free Trade?
2.Skills: Braining Storming
3.The Quiz: Building Relationships
4.Listening Practice: How Companies Building Strong Business Relationships
5.Discussion: What are the Most Important Relationships for You?
6.Vocabulary: Describing Relations (A+B)
Note: Advertising Campaign for (a Taiwanese product) to Be Marketed Internationally
6 (10 /16 )
1. Oral Presentation: Advertising Campaign for (a Taiwanese product) to Be Marketed Internationally
7 ( 10/23 )
1.Vocabulary: Describing Relations (C+D)
2.Listening Practice: Business Partnerships
3.Reading and Discussion: Business Networks in China
4.Language Review: Multi-word Verbs (A)
5.Skills: Networking
8 (10/30)
Midterm Exam
*Doing Business Internationally (Task 1＆2)
HW: Write a Response to Melissa’s Blog to Advise Her on the Best Way to Do Business in Russia.
9 ( 11/06 )
1.Discussion: The Response to Melissa’s Blog to Advise Her on the Best Way to Do Business in Russia.
2.Business Skills: How to Make Great Small Talk(2:33-10:45)
3.Discussion: What Makes People Successful?
4.Vocabulary Development: Prefix (C+D)
5.Listening Activities: Successful Businesses
HW: What Makes a Successful Business Person
10 ( 11/13 )
1.Discussion: What Makes a Successful Business Person
2.Reading and Discussion: Profile: Carlos Slim
3.Skills: Negotiating
4.Case Study--Kensington United: Negotiate a Sponsorship Deal for a Football Club
5.Discussion: Job Satisfaction
HW: 1.Case Study and the Role Playing.
2. For What Reasons Might You Change Jobs?
Note: 1. Case Study and the Role Playing
2. Oral Presentation: The Most Successful Companies in Taiwan (including What Makes Them So Successful)
11 ( 11/20 )
*No Class
12 (11 /27)
1.Discussion: For What Reasons Might You Change Jobs?
2.The Quiz: Are You in Danger of Burning Out?
3.Vocabulary: Synonyms and Word-building
4.Discussion: What Do You Find Frustrating/Satisfying about Your Studies or Work?
Note: Case Study and the Role Playing
13 (12 /04)
1.Case Study and the Role Playing
2.Listening Practice: Staff Motivation
3.Reading and Discussion: Working for the Best Company(the Handout)
4.Skills: Cold-calling
5.Discussion: Are You a Risk-taker?
6.Vocabulary: Describing Risk
HW: 1. Which Company Would You Like to Work for and Why?
2. Globalization-Risk or Opportunity?
Note: Oral Presentation: The Most Successful Companies in Taiwan (including What Makes Them So Successful)
14 ( 12/11 )
1.Which Company Would You Like to Work for and Why?
2.Listening Practice: Managing Risks
3.Discussion: Globalization-Risk or Opportunity?
4.Reading: Insurance Trade Risks
5.Skills: Reaching Agreement
Note: Oral Presentation: The Most Successful Companies in Taiwan (including What Makes Them So Successful)
15 (12/18 )
1.Oral Presentation: The Most Successful Companies in Taiwan (including What Makes Them So Successful)
16 (12/27 )
1.Final Exam
2.Class Review ＆ Evaluation
17 (1 /01)
No Class
18 ( 1/08)
Flex supplement teaching week教師彈性教學周

Evaluation
(評量方式)

■Class Participation (出席率) 20％
■Midterm Test (期中考) 20％
■Final Test (期末考) 20％
■Presentation (專題發表) 40％

ch: 系所:限經濟學系。年級:限三年級、四年級。
系所:限經濟學系碩士班、經濟學系博士班。
系所:限輔系-經濟學系、雙主修-經濟學系。
系所:限數學系。年級:限三年級、四年級。
學制:限學士班。學院:限管理學院。年級:限三年級、四年級。
學院:限非管理學院。年級:限三年級、四年級。
en: Department:Department of Economics only.Year:Third Year、Fourth Year only.
Department:Master of Economics、PhD in Economics only.
Department:Department of Mathematics only.Year:Third Year、Fourth Year only.
Type:Undergraduate Program only.Faculty:College of Management only.Year:Third Year、Fourth Year only.
